text: Iraq's Shiite LED government has
declared victory in the nine-month
battle to retake Mosul from the Islamic
state but a rack's war isn't over
Isis's ideology gained support among
Mosul sunni residents and could feed a
new brutal wave of sectarian fighting
the big challenge now for Iraqi forces
is weeding out Isis supporters without
alienating the wider Sunni population
here are the tactics they've been using
for better or worse the Iraqi
authorities have leaned on local Sunni
leaders to denounce Isis and have also
relied on anonymous informants and
civilians to ID Isis supporters that has
led to widespread distrust within the
Sunni community and resentment towards
the government as of civilians have been
killed in almost a million displaced
with many detained in poor conditions
and camps as the fight from Mosul has
raged on for it's mostly Sunni residents
the city has been largely obliterated so
they have nothing to return to women and
children are separated from the men who
are taken to screening centers to
determine if they are members of Isis
homes of families suspected of being
sympathetic to Isis are demolished and
more recently entire families of Isis
suspects have been forcibly held in
so-called rehabilitation camps
there are at least 2,000 Isis suspects
in detention in the wake of Mosul Iraqi
law requires detainees be brought before
an investigative judge within 48 hours
but many have been kept in inhumane
conditions in prisons for months for
example in one room was a cell of four
meters by 6 114 men in there since four
months they're not allowed to leave the
room the windows have been bricked up so
the temperature and the stench is so bad
that multiple men actually died in these
prisons because they couldn't breathe
those who do make it to court often face
accusations from confidential informants
and are mostly presumed guilty from the
start as Mosul fell many Isis fighters
shave their beards and shed their
trademark short Arab style gowns and
fled with civilians blending back into
the local population many bearded men
left behind were assumed by Iraqi forces
to be Isis little actual evidence
exemplifying the wider challenge faced
by authorities how to separate the
innocent from the guilty come on Raffi
forces have been accused by human rights
groups of torturing and executing Isis
suspects captured on the battlefield
especially in the last few weeks
initially around this time footage
believed to be of Iraqi forces beating
and executing unarmed men and mrs. old
city and on the banks of the Tigris
River appeared on social media
[Music]
videos posted to social media by Iraqi
forces appeared to show them in some
instances indiscriminately firing on
targets footage from a Lebanon based
network also showed suspected Isis
fighters trying to escape amid heavy
gunfire on the Tigris River while
targeting an enemy on the battlefield is
within rules of engagement in the final
days of Mosul it was unclear how many of
the people still trapped inside were
actually innocent civilians while
victory and Mosul has been hailed by
authorities as the end of Isis the real
challenge will be winning hearts and
minds of Iraq's Sunni population so
groups like Isis can no longer survive
that's really the only way Iraq will
ever be at peace with itself
